Text:
I think...it's time I stop walking in front of you,
Cid.
Huh? Why the sudden change?

Alexia and you have a friendship where you are
equals, do you not?

Equals...I get the feeling we aren't that at all...
well, but...hmmm?

If I wanted to learn more how Alexia feels, then I
should have done things more like her. I realized
this only now, well after the fact.

Well, yeah...I guess from the way we've been walking,
we look like an officer and an apprentice...or even like
a master and servant.

S-So you really do think that's how we've been
perceived?! Oh dear, how could I have done
something so terribly rude to Alexia's friend...

Uh, again, please don't bow to meâ€”it'll only draw
more unwanted attention!

I understand... Well then, from now on, please walk
by my side, Cid.

Argh, just shoot me already...er, no, I mean, please
don't shoot me...!

Guided by Cid, Iris walks along the random path
he and Alexia took while incognito.
This way, princess. There's a large group ahead.
Oh! All right...

(I suppose he's keeping close watch on our
surroundings.)

(Come to think of it...he's being my escort, isn't
he.)
(This just doesn't feel natural to me...)
Is it difficult to walk?
Huh?
You're um, frowning.

Oh dear...it's showing in my face. Well, it's not
difficult to walk, exactly, I'm just not accustomed
to being escorted in this manner...
Huh?! Y-You think that's what we're doing?!

Wait a minute...has she been living under a deeper
rock than Alexia? Is she the queen-of-the-sheltered
aristocrat trope?!
Um...Cid?
Er, n-never mind... It's nothing.

As a princess of Midgar, I have taken etiquette
lessons.

However, in pouring all of my focus into learning the
sword so I could fulfill my duties to the royal family,
I may have gotten much more comfortable with
that side of myself.
Nope! She's the dumb musclehead trope!

Okay, then...do you want me to drop the whole
"escort" thing?

No...please keep doing it. I mustn't run and hide
from what makes me uncomfortable.
Urk! Okay...understood.

Cid, I have a question. And please be honest with
me...
What is it?

Am I attracting attention again? I have the sensation
that I am not blending in with the city.

I only hope that people aren't mocking me for looking
so uncomfortable with my escort...
It doesn't look that way to me...

Cid shuts his mouth and listens to the conversations
around them. Iris also turns her ears to the crowd...

Look, it's Princess Iris! She is walking with a boy! 
They look lovely together, don't they?

I wonder who that young man is? He must be an
aristocrat, since he's walking with the princess.

He doesn't look that highborn... Unless...this is a
forbidden romance with a commoner?!

Might not be her boyfriend. He mighta done
something...maybe he's a thief.

Yeah, makes sense. I mean, he's got thug written all
over that face!
(Oh my goodness!)

Gasping at the conversation she overhears, Iris
turns to look at Cid.
Cid, why do theyâ€”
Yeah, I guess that's how we look to everyone else.
But how dare they even talk of our affairs!

They believe you committed a crime and I'm taking you
to be punished... You're being falsely accused, Cid.

And even though you're only the son of a baron, you
are still a full-fledged aristocrat. Nobody would blame
you if you got angry with them.
You think so? I don't really mind, though.

Did this sort of thing...also happen when you were
with Alexia?
Excuse me?

When you were out with Alexia in the city, when
people recognized who she was, did they think it
was unnatural for you two to be side by side?
Well, she was incognito, so nobody really noticed.
Cid. You're not answering my question.
Urk. Indeed not...

When I was with Alexia... Well, yeah. People who
noticed who she was seemed to be uncomfortable.

But I still didn't really care. That sort of thing
happens at school, too anywaâ€”
It happens at school, too?!

Iris yelpsâ€”immediately clamping a hand on her mouth
afterwards.

(Not only in the city...but at school as well...
How did it make her feel?)

(When you and your friend come from such different
social classes, does the act of simply standing beside
him make people look upon you with confusion and
disdain?)

(And since Alexia has spent much more time with Cid
than I have, this sort of thing must have been on her
mind all the more often.)
Um...Princess?

(I think I know now... I know a little of how Alexia
feels.)

(Alexia is coming of age... She probably didn't like
having her relationship judged like that.)
Oh, Princess? Are you listeninnng?
Cid!
Urg?! Yes!
We mustn't let this situation go overlooked!

I kinnnda have a bad feeling about what you're gonna
say next...

You two share an innocent friendship. It is not okay
for people to make strange assumptions.
We must make the relationship public!
Um...what?!

Cid, you and I are here, on an outing. It would be
perfectly apt to call us friends.

We are not here on business, neither am I arresting
you, of course. So we should announce that we are
here as friends.
Uh, nonono! Hold up! Wait just a minute!

Wait for what? If we go public, people will stop
slandering you.
Uhh...let's see...how should I put this?

I appreciate the sentiment...but please, don't worry
about me.
It's fine. I'm used to it.
Yes, butâ€”!

Please don't make me explain myself any further...
I just...I don't want to stand out!
Oh!

If my friendship with you and your sister goes any
more public than it already has, that'll greatly
impede my ability to be an NPC andâ€”
Hm?
Er, n-never mind! Just monologuing!

So! Anyway, I don't care what other people think
about our relationship. All that matters is that the
people in it know what it's about!
Cid's blunt words echo loudly in Iris's heart...

And the boy before her eyes looks even more
chivalrous...even more noble than before...
(Ohh...so that's what it was!)

(This is what Alexia likes about him...it's what made
her want to form a relationship with him.)

I have seen far too many people who wished to flaunt
their relationships with royalty and use them for
personal gain.
But...you're different.

If anything, you act like you don't want to be seen
with me... You don't put on airs. And I think that's
what Alexia likes about you.

Cid...I hope that you will continue being a good
friend to Alexia.
Oh! Um...yes, I will.
